akn:section.akn:heading: Consultation with National Park System Advisory Board

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 312106. Consultation with National Park System Advisory Board In carrying out its functions under this chapter, the National Trust may consult with the National Park System Advisory Board on matters relating to the selection of sites, buildings, and objects to be preserved and protected pursuant to this chapter. (Pub. L. 113–287, § 3, Dec. 19, 2014, 128 Stat. 3251.)
Historical and Revision Notes
RevisedSectionSource (U.S. Code)Source (Statutes at Large)
31210616 U.S.C. 468d.Oct. 26, 1949, ch. 735, § 5, 63 Stat. 929.
The words “National Park System Advisory Board” are substituted for “Advisory Board on National Parks, Historic Sites, Buildings, and Museums” because the Board was renamed when section 3 of the Act of August 21, 1935 (known as the Historic Sites, Buildings, and Antiquities Act (ch. 593, 49 Stat. 667)) was amended by section 9 of Public Law 91–383, as added by section 2 of Public Law 94–458 (90 Stat. 1940).
